docs.text: some movies' pre-release buzz is so insistent on their high oscar potential that when they're finally released , everyone just goes along with it .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: thus sometimes , films unworthy of any award sans the razzie become oscar hopefuls and some even score nominations .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: last year it was the thin red line .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: this year's " winner " is the hurricane , pure unadulterated tripe that is all of a sudden being received with critical plaudits and votes in the office oscar pool .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: acclaimed director norman jewison's biopic retreads all the conventions of courtroom movies without any of the fun .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: and that's supposed to be ok because , see , it's a true story .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it's about rubin " hurricane " carter ( denzel washington ) , a legendary african american prizefighted who is unjustly convicted of triple homicide with the help of a ghastly ( racist ! )
docs.label: negative

docs.text: detective ( dan hedaya ) who's had it in for the " big-shot " hurricane ever since he arrested him for stabbing a white man with a knife ( in self-defense but who cares , right ? )
docs.label: negative

docs.text: when rubin was only ten .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: he is to serve three life sentences with no possibility of parole .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: most of the film takes place when he is in his 15th year in prison .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: to the rescue -- lesra martin ( vicellous reon shannon ) and his team of wanna-be detectives .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: lesra is an african american teenager taken in by three well-off canadian white people ( hanna , unger , schreiber ) to get an education .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: lesra and his buddies go to a book sale where lesra picks out his very first book -- " the sixteenth round , " rubin's autobiography .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: immediately thereafter , schreiber's character tells lesra " sometimes we don't pick the books we read , they pick us . "
docs.label: negative

docs.text: hmmm .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: after a few visits to the prison , they become convinced of rubin's innocence and launch their own full-scale investigation even though two juries have convicted him .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: they meticulously go through all the files and revisit all the old witnesses ( i wonder if any of them might be cranky old women who slam the door in their faces ? ) and in the course of their relentlessy tedious sleuthing uncover obvious evidence confirming the hurricane's innocence that was either ignored or never seeked out during the first two proceedings .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: of course , we're already told that he's innocent .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: a movie like this is especially frustrating because we're not being shown everything significant that happened to carter during this period in his life .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: all too obviously , we're getting the hollywood watered- down version .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: that would be ok except that the parts we are getting is milked for every single drop of melodrama that the filmmakers could possibly squeeze out of it .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it's almost cruel .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the melodrama isn't of the entertaining kind either ; it's the hokey , rammed-down-your-throat variety where every emotion is exaggerated to the point of absurdity .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: witness the villain ferociously grinding his teeth at the final trial or the constant pseudo-saintliness of our four protagonists .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the hurricane is your basic courtroom movie except it's a no-frills courtroom movie .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it's formula stripped to the bare necessities .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: you have your wrongly accused black man .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: you have your melodramatic final courtroom scene .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: but there's nothing else .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: you'd expect some sort of involving investigation .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: but that's not necessary since we're implicitly informed of his innocence .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: thus the whole middle portion of the movie is reduced to the protagonist brooding .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: brooding to himself .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: brooding to other inmates .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: brooding to lesra .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: brooding to lesra's canadian friends .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: brooding in letters .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i don't think i'll ever look at brooding the same way again .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it wasn't long before i got tired of hearing the hurricane's exceedingly deep meditations on his condition .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i wanted something to happen .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: as for washington's performance in the title role -- i figured i'd have to address it sooner or later considering the amount of attention it's received -- he is top notch , though still boring .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: how is that possible ?
docs.label: negative

docs.text: well , he does what jewison wanted him to do perfectly .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: unfortunately what jewison asked him to do is a load of crap .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: what a waste of a great performer .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: speaking of wastes , why the hell did john hannah agree to do this ?
docs.label: negative

docs.text: he's an extremely talented actor and i love him dearly , but what is he doing here ?
docs.label: negative

docs.text: to call his character ( along with schreiber's and unger's ) a stick figure would be a gross understatement .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: all three of them come off as veritable mother theresas , as benevolent as do-gooders come .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: if they're to play a major part in this movie , why not make them real people , with real feelings and emotions ?
docs.label: negative

docs.text: look : if you're going to make a formula movie , don't undermine the formula .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: courtroom dramas can be fun , but this is ridiculous .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: not only is it trite , it's boring .
docs.label: negative
